position.marginalia_text: Ha[e]c omnia breuissima, facillima, dulcissima: et citissimè percursa: vsus aute[m]

marginalia.translation: All these things are most short, easy, and pleasant, and are passed over most quickly: but for daily and endless use.

position.marginalia_text: The onlie ( Summist of arts, & practises.
{ Nerui artis, et medulla ingenij. Occulta[e] / artificium proprietates, et specifica[e] professorum differentia[e].

marginalia.translation: The sinews of art and the marrow of the intellect. The hidden qualities of professions and the specific differences of professors.

position.marginalia_text: Arts, et Virtus in specialissima specie. ( Prat[e]ij aureu[m] alphabetu[m] Legu[m] Rom: Lipsius de Magistratibus.

marginalia.translation: Art and virtue are in the most special kind. Peter of Ravenna 'The golden alphabet of the Roman laws', Lipsius 'On magistrates'.

Denis Godefroy's 'Institutions' with Joachim Hoppers's fourth book of the 'Elementorum iuris' is a start, the half of the whole. Johannes Althusius's 'Art of law' is half more than the whole: but all by heart.

position.marginalia_text: [p. 143: Excellunt iudicio Ca[e]sar, Sallustius, Virgilius: qui soli possunt prudentissimu[m] viru[m] efficere: pra[e]sertim cum Ciceronis Officijs: de administranda prouincia: de petitione Consulatus. Pragmaticum etiam astutissimu[m] Tacitus, Gandinus, Durandus. Pra[e]sertim cu[m] Mithridatis epistola, et concione contra Romanos: = = Aristotelis politicis, Oeconomicisq[ue] technis: Xenophontis Tyranno: Dionis apistia: Plutarchi politicis: Jouis Elogio Ca[e]saris Borgia[e]: Catharina[e] Medicea[e] practicis:] Equitis Poncetti discursu aulico de Principijs imperij Turcici:

book.title: Ritratti allocuzioni e pensieri scelti dalla storia d'Italia

marginalia.translation: [p. 143: Caesar, Sallust, and Virgil excel in judgement, they alone who can create the most prudent man: especially with Cicero's 'On duties', 'On administering an office', 'On running for the consulship'. Also Tactitus, Gandinus, and Durandus [can create] a most astute pragmatist. Especially with Mithridatis' letter and with his speech against the Romans: and with Aristotle's economic and political artifices: with Xenophon's 'Hiero', Dio Chrysostom's 'Diffidence', Plutarch's political 'Opuscula', with the Giovio's' eulogy of Cesare Borgia, with the practices of Catherine de' Medici:] With the golden discourse of Maurice Poncet, a knight, 'on the rulers of the Turkish empire', Francesco Guicciardini's 'Ritratti', 'In Phalaridis tyranni agrigentini Epistolas', with the 'letters of Mehmed 2'.

position.marginalia_text: Discursus discursuu[m], Bodini Methodus historica: cum totius Romana[e] historia[e] speculo aureo, Eutropio: externa[e], Justino: vtriusq[ue] simul, Neandro.

book.title: Externae historiae in compendium ab Iustino redacta

marginalia.translation: Bodin's 'Methodus historica', the discourse of discourses: with Eutropius' 'golden mirror of all Roman history': with Justin's 'Externae'. At the same time of both, Neander.
